recordings.rmk: Unusual call. And singing at the end. Birding with biol. Bruno Lima invited to collaborate with my project "Birds of Itatiaia NP".

recordings.rmk: Calls of a group of 8 guans. They roosted in a clump of bamboo near a small hotel (Recanto dos Esquilos) where I stayed. The guans were more noisy during this second night.

recordings.loc: Parque Nacional do Itatiaia, State of Rio de Janeiro, -22.26, -44.36
recordings.rmk: Calls of a group of 8 guans roosting in bamboo near a small hotel (Recanto dos Esquilos) where I stayed. The birds were often fed by the hotel owners and were rather tame. The nearest guan group was about 0.5 km away.

Registro de espécie ameaçada de extinção gravada na Estação Ecológica de Aiuaba sob a licença Sisbio nº 58248 em projeto da Associação de Pesquisa e Preservação de Ecossistemas Aquáticos financiado pela Fundação Grupo Boticário de Proteção à Natureza, acompanhado por Rafael G. Becker e Eric A. A. Alexandre. Vegetação ciliar de caatinga, onde o bando se empoleirava no dossel florestal ao crepúsculo, certamente para dormir, sendo atraído por emissão de som previamente gravado. Consta o ruído de uma aeronave.

recordings.loc: 10 km S Pocone on Transpantaneira, Mato Grosso
recordings.rmk: Calls (in alarm over my presence) from two birds from crown of Cecropia over water, but flew upon closer approach. Not seen particularly well (throat color not seen; birds at this site have both blue and blue-and-red throats), so 'taxon' presumed.

recordings.rmk: About 40ft away on edge of grassy yard in middle of what appears to be previously logged terra firme. Single widely spaced whistles leading up to series of 5 faster and louder ascending whistles starting at 0:45, the ascending series then ending with one descending whistle. Perched in a tree right out in the open.
Pre-dawn vocalizing near the lodge volunteer dorms. Terra firme forest.

Porto Alegre camp -- Biological Dynamics of Forest Fragments Project
recordings.rmk: This bird was recorded calling from the midstory of a primary forest plot (reserve 3512) at the BDFFP. The bird had originally been on the forest floor before I flushed it, at which point I registered this recording (it then flushed again towards the end of this track). Aside from normalizing, the recording was unaltered. This recording is also archived at the Macaulay Library (ML219893791).
